notes_main_articles.title: Cannabis in the United Arab Emirates

notes_text: In 2008, even the smallest amounts of the drug could lead to a mandatory 4-year prison sentence.
notes_raw: {{main|Cannabis in the United Arab Emirates}} In 2008, even the smallest amounts of the drug could lead to a mandatory 4-year prison sentence.<ref>{{cite news |url = https://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/uk/7234786.stm |title = Tourists warned of UAE drug laws |publisher = [[BBC News]] |date = 8 February 2008 |access-date = 17 February 2011 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170420193949/http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/uk_news/7234786.stm |archive-date=20 April 2017 |url-status=live}}</ref>{{Update inline|date=October 2023|reason=Laws changed in 2016 and again in 2022.}}
{{main|Cannabis in Antigua and Barbuda}}

notes_text: Prohibited but plants highly available throughout the country and law often unenforced. On 21 July 2023 the Albanian Parliament voted 69–23 to legalize medical cannabis.
notes_raw:
{{main|Cannabis in Albania}} Prohibited but plants highly available throughout the country and law often unenforced.<ref name="setimes-albania">{{citation |url = http://www.setimes.com/cocoon/setimes/xhtml/en_GB/features/setimes/features/2012/08/07/feature-03 |title = Growing marijuana is an increasing regional problem |publisher = SETimes.com |date = 7 August 2012 |access-date = 18 April 2013 |archive-date = 4 March 2016 |archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20160304045944/http://www.setimes.com/cocoon/setimes/xhtml/en_GB/features/setimes/features/2012/08/07/feature-03 |url-status = live }}</ref><ref name="balkaninsight-albania-1">{{citation |url = http://www.balkaninsight.com/en/article/report-cannabis-growth-mounts-in-albania |title = Report Says Albania Cannabis Growth Mounting |date = 7 March 2013 |access-date = 18 April 2013 |publisher = balkaninsight.com |archive-date = 30 September 2018 |archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20180930100941/http://www.balkaninsight.com/en/article/report-cannabis-growth-mounts-in-albania |url-status = live }}</ref><ref name="balkaninsight-albania-2">{{citation |url = http://www.balkaninsight.com/en/article/albania-police-bust-major-cannabis-shipments |title = Albanian Police Seize Cannabis Shipment |publisher = balkaninsight.com |date = 28 December 2011 |access-date = 5 June 2018 |archive-date = 5 September 2017 |archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20170905095749/http://www.balkaninsight.com/en/article/albania-police-bust-major-cannabis-shipments |url-status = live }}</ref>
On 21 July 2023 the [[Albanian Parliament]] voted 69–23 to legalize medical cannabis.<ref>{{cite news |title=Albanian Parliament legalizes medical cannabis despite harsh opposition |url=https://apnews.com/article/albania-legalize-medical-cannabis-trafficking-drugs-81c423f05a08537f606fb4dc535f8bfa |access-date=24 July 2023 |publisher=[[Associated Press]] |date=21 July 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230813230102/https://apnews.com/article/albania-legalize-medical-cannabis-trafficking-drugs-81c423f05a08537f606fb4dc535f8bfa |archive-date=13 August 2023 |url-status=live}}</ref>
{{main|Cannabis in Armenia}}
{{main|Cannabis in Angola}}

notes_text: Medicinal cannabis was legalized on 22 September 2017.
notes_raw: {{main|Cannabis in Argentina}} Medicinal cannabis was legalized on 22 September 2017.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.infobae.com/politica/2017/09/22/el-gobierno-reglamento-la-ley-de-cannabis-medicinal/ |title=El Gobierno reglamentó la ley de cannabis medicinal |date=22 September 2017 |publisher=[[Infobae]] |access-date=4 January 2023 |archive-date=8 June 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210608073626/https://www.infobae.com/politica/2017/09/22/el-gobierno-reglamento-la-ley-de-cannabis-medicinal/ |url-status=live |language=es}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.argentina.gob.ar/justicia/derechofacil/leysimple/cannabis-medicinal |title=Cannabis medicinal |author=<!--not stated--> |website=Argentina.gob.ar |date=12 July 2019 |publisher=[[Government of Argentina]] |trans-title=Medicinal cannabis |language=es |access-date=2024-01-04 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231206063257/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/justicia/derechofacil/leysimple/cannabis-medicinal |archive-date=2023-12-06}}</ref>
{{main|Cannabis in Austria}}

notes_text: In September 2019, the Australian Capital Territory became the first state or territory of Australia to legalize recreational use of cannabis. Since 31 January 2020 residents have been allowed to grow two plants and possess , though sales or other transfer is prohibited, including cannabis seeds. Federal law also remains enforceable.
notes_raw: {{main|Cannabis in Australia}} In September 2019, the [[Australian Capital Territory]] became the first state or territory of Australia to legalize recreational use of cannabis. Since 31 January 2020 residents have been allowed to grow two plants and possess {{cvt|50|g|frac=4}}, though sales or other transfer is prohibited, including cannabis seeds. Federal law also remains enforceable.<ref name="ACT">{{cite news |last=Lowrey |first=Tom |title=ACT legalises personal cannabis use but warns smokers they're not safe from federal laws |url=https://www.abc.net.au/news/2019-09-25/act-first-jurisdiction-to-legalise-personal-cannabis-use/11530104 |access-date=11 December 2019 |publisher=[[Australian Broadcasting Corporation|ABC News]] |date=25 September 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20191005020408/https://www.abc.net.au/news/2019-09-25/act-first-jurisdiction-to-legalise-personal-cannabis-use/11530104 |archive-date=5 October 2019 |url-status=live}}</ref>
{{main|Cannabis in Azerbaijan}}

notes_text: In 2016, the Ministry of Civil Affairs formed a task force to explore the legalization of cannabis and cannabinoids for medicinal purposes.
notes_raw: {{main|Cannabis in Bosnia and Herzegovina}} In 2016, the Ministry of Civil Affairs formed a task force to explore the legalization of cannabis and [[cannabinoids]] for medicinal purposes.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.bosniatoday.ba/bosnia-to-legalize-medical-marijuana-this-year/ |title=Bosnia to legalize medical marijuana this year |website=Bosnia Today |access-date=30 November 2016 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160924221422/http://www.bosniatoday.ba/bosnia-to-legalize-medical-marijuana-this-year/ |archive-date=24 September 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://n1info.hr/regija/bih-legalizirala-medicinski-kanabis/ |title=BiH legalizirala medicinski kanabis |language=bs |website=n1info.hr |date=2025-12-29 |access-date=2026-01-10}}</ref>
{{main|Cannabis in Barbados}}

notes_text: Sale banned in 1989, but laws are rarely enforced and cannabis is openly sold in many parts of the country.
notes_raw: {{main|Cannabis in Bangladesh}} Sale banned in 1989,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://dhakainsider.com/bangladesh-news/drug-abuse-where-is-the-way-of-remedy-part-ii-some-dangerous-silent-killers/ |title=Drug Abuse: Where is The Way of Remedy? (Part II- Some Dangerous Silent Killers) |publisher=DhakaInsider |date=20 June 2014 |access-date=15 November 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161115140731/http://dhakainsider.com/bangladesh-news/drug-abuse-where-is-the-way-of-remedy-part-ii-some-dangerous-silent-killers/ |archive-date=15 November 2016 |url-status=dead}}</ref> but laws are rarely enforced and cannabis is openly sold in many parts of the country.<ref>{{cite web |author1=Government of Bangladesh |author-link1=Government of Bangladesh |title=Narcotics Substances Control Act, 2018 |url=http://bdlaws.minlaw.gov.bd/act-details-1276.html |access-date=11 November 2016 |archive-date=11 October 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20191011034412/http://bdlaws.minlaw.gov.bd/act-details-1276.html |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=Dhaka, Bangladesh – We Be High |url=http://webehigh.org/dhaka-bangladesh/ |website=webehigh.org |publisher=webehigh |access-date=5 December 2015 |archive-date=30 June 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180630024753/http://webehigh.org/dhaka-bangladesh/ |url-status=live }}</ref>

notes_text: Up to decriminalized for adults since 2003.
notes_raw: {{main|Cannabis in Belgium}} Up to {{cvt|3|g|frac=10}} decriminalized for adults since 2003.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.polfed-fedpol.be/|title=Federale politie – Police fédérale|author=Police fédérale – CGPR Webteam|access-date=14 January 2015|archive-date=26 December 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181226021500/https://www.politie.be//nl|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title = Cannabis legal status vault – Belgium |url = http://www.erowid.org/plants/cannabis/cannabis_law.shtml#belgium |website = www.erowid.org |publisher = Erowid.org |access-date = 17 February 2011 |archive-date = 15 December 2019 |archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20191215152836/https://www.erowid.org/plants/cannabis/cannabis_law.shtml#belgium |url-status = live }}</ref>
{{main|Cannabis in Burkina Faso}}

notes_text: Cannabis is classified as a class A (High-risk) drug, together with heroin, cocaine, amphetamines, and MDMA (ecstasy). Until 2004, a loosely defined "personal dose" existed.
notes_raw: {{main|Cannabis in Bulgaria}} Cannabis is classified as a class A (High-risk) drug, together with [[heroin]], [[cocaine]], [[amphetamines]], and [[MDMA]] (ecstasy). Until 2004, a loosely defined "personal dose" existed.<ref>{{cite web |title=Bulgaria: Country Drug Report 2017 |url=http://www.emcdda.europa.eu/countries/drug-reports/2017/bulgaria/drug-laws-and-offences_en |publisher=European Monitoring Centre for Drugs and Drug Addiction |access-date=17 October 2018 |archive-date=17 October 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181017123705/http://www.emcdda.europa.eu/countries/drug-reports/2017/bulgaria/drug-laws-and-offences_en |url-status=live }}</ref>

notes_text: In November 2016, the Supreme Court of Bermuda ruled in favor of allowing the medical use of cannabis. As of July 2018, two doctors have been licensed to prescribe the drug.
notes_raw: {{main|Cannabis in Bermuda}} In November 2016, the [[Law of Bermuda#Litigation and the Bermuda Court System|Supreme Court of Bermuda]] ruled in favor of allowing the medical use of cannabis.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Bell |first1=Jonathan |title=People can apply for medical cannabis |url=http://www.royalgazette.com/news/article/20161125/people-can-apply-for-medical-cannabis |access-date=27 October 2018 |work=[[The Royal Gazette (Bermuda)|The Royal Gazette]] |date=25 November 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181027232029/http://www.royalgazette.com/news/article/20161125/people-can-apply-for-medical-cannabis |archive-date=27 October 2018 |url-status=live}}</ref> As of July 2018, two doctors have been licensed to prescribe the drug.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Bell |first1=Jonathan |title=Weeks: we need to talk about cannabis |url=http://www.royalgazette.com/politics/article/20180725/weeks-we-need-to-talk-about-cannabis |access-date=27 October 2018 |work=[[The Royal Gazette (Bermuda)|The Royal Gazette]] |date=25 July 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181101101737/http://www.royalgazette.com/politics/article/20180725/weeks-we-need-to-talk-about-cannabis |archive-date=1 November 2018 |url-status=live}}</ref>
{{main|Cannabis in Brunei}}
{{main|Cannabis in Bolivia}}

notes_text: Legislation passed in 2006 to require treatment and community service for possessing small amounts of drugs instead of jail time. Possession of large amounts, as well as sale, transportation, and cultivation, are considered drug trafficking.
notes_raw: {{main|Cannabis in Brazil}} Legislation passed in 2006 to require treatment and community service for possessing small amounts of drugs instead of jail time.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Smith |first1=Phillip |title=Brazilian President Signs New Drug Law – No Jail for Users |url=https://stopthedrugwar.org/chronicle/2006/aug/31/feature_brazilian_president_sign |access-date=3 August 2021 |work=stopthedrugwar.org |date=31 August 2006 |archive-date=3 August 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210803165114/https://stopthedrugwar.org/chronicle/2006/aug/31/feature_brazilian_president_sign |url-status=live }}</ref> Possession of large amounts, as well as sale, transportation, and cultivation, are considered drug trafficking.<ref>{{cite web |author1=Congresso Nacional |author-link1=Congress of Brazil |title=Lei nº 11.343 |url=http://www.planalto.gov.br/ccivil_03/_Ato2004-2006/2006/Lei/L11343.htm |website=www.planalto.gov.br |publisher=Presidência da República – Casa Civil |location=Brasília |language=pt-br |date=23 August 2006 |access-date=13 October 2009 |archive-date=25 November 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181125030720/http://www.planalto.gov.br/ccivil_03/_ato2004-2006/2006/lei/l11343.htm |url-status=live }}</ref>

notes_text: Illegal, but plants grow prolifically and have multiple traditional uses, such as feeding pigs and producing textiles.
notes_raw: {{main|Cannabis in Bhutan}} Illegal, but plants grow prolifically and have multiple traditional uses, such as feeding pigs and producing textiles.<ref>{{cite journal|title=Bhutan|journal=UNODC: South Asia Regional Profile|date=September 2005|pages=21–26|url=https://www.unodc.org/pdf/india/publications/south_Asia_Regional_Profile_Sept_2005/09_bhutan.pdf|access-date=30 November 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180630080824/https://www.unodc.org/pdf/india/publications/south_Asia_Regional_Profile_Sept_2005/09_bhutan.pdf|archive-date=30 June 2018|url-status=live}}</ref>

notes_text: Cannabis (or ''dagga'') is illegal.
notes_raw: {{main|Cannabis in Botswana}} Cannabis (or ''dagga'') is illegal.<ref>{{cite web |url = http://www.issafrica.org/cdct/mainpages/pdf/Organised%20Crime/Legislation/Botswana/Botswana%20Drugs%20and%20Related%20Substances%20Act%2018%20of%201992%20.pdf |title = Drugs and related substances act no. 18 of 1992 |publisher = Government of Botswana |access-date = 3 October 2013 |url-status = dead |archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20131006215219/http://www.issafrica.org/cdct/mainpages/pdf/Organised%20Crime/Legislation/Botswana/Botswana%20Drugs%20and%20Related%20Substances%20Act%2018%20of%201992%20.pdf |archive-date = 6 October 2013}}</ref>
{{main|Cannabis in Belarus}}

notes_text: Possession prohibited, but use is common and largely tolerated. Possession of up to decriminalized.
notes_raw: {{main|Cannabis in Belize}} Possession prohibited, but use is common and largely tolerated.<ref>{{cite web|last=Hubbard|first=Kirsten|title=Drug Laws and Penalties in Central America|url=http://gocentralamerica.about.com/od/culturehistory/p/Central-America-Drug-Laws-And-Penalties.htm|publisher=About.com|access-date=2 January 2014|archive-date=14 May 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170514082404/http://gocentralamerica.about.com/od/culturehistory/p/Central-America-Drug-Laws-And-Penalties.htm|url-status=dead}}</ref> Possession of up to {{cvt|10|g|frac=8}} decriminalized.<ref>{{cite news |title=The Future of Marijuana under Debate |url=https://edition.channel5belize.com/archives/157025 |access-date=7 January 2024 |work=News 5 |date=5 December 2017}}</ref>

notes_text: Since 2017, consuming cannabis in Switzerland may result in a fine, but possession of up to without evidence of consumption is not penalized; and as of 2023, confiscated amounts under this limit must be returned to the individual.
notes_raw: {{Main|Cannabis in Switzerland}} Since 2017, consuming cannabis in Switzerland may result in a fine, but possession of up to {{cvt|10|g|frac=8}} without evidence of consumption is not penalized; and as of 2023, confiscated amounts under this limit must be returned to the individual.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.admin.ch/ch/f/ff/2012/7539.pdf |title=FF 2012 7539 |access-date=16 November 2016 |archive-date=17 May 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200517154324/https://www.admin.ch/opc/fr/federal-gazette/2012/7539.pdf |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-07-24 |title=Leiturteil des Bundesgerichts – Cannabis: bis 10 Gramm Eigenkonsum keine Beschlagnahmung möglich |url=https://www.srf.ch/news/schweiz/leiturteil-des-bundesgerichts-cannabis-bis-10-gramm-eigenkonsum-keine-beschlagnahmung-moeglich |access-date=2024-03-10 |website=Schweizer Radio und Fernsehen (SRF) |language=de}}</ref>

notes_text: A non-binding referendum in August 2022 asked "Should we review our cannabis laws to allow for research and medicinal use?" 62% voted yes.
notes_raw: {{main|Cannabis in the Cook Islands}} A [[2022 Cook Islands medical cannabis referendum|non-binding referendum]] in August 2022 asked "Should we review our cannabis laws to allow for research and medicinal use?" 62% voted yes.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Kumar |first1=Rashneel |title=62 per cent vote yes for cannabis law reform |url=https://www.cookislandsnews.com/internal/national/breaking-news/62-per-cent-vote-yes-for-cannabis-law-reform/ |access-date=11 January 2023 |work=Cook Islands News |date=11 August 2022 |archive-date=11 January 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230111204302/https://www.cookislandsnews.com/internal/national/breaking-news/62-per-cent-vote-yes-for-cannabis-law-reform/ |url-status=live }}</ref>

notes_text: Private personal use and recreational cultivation decriminalized. Medicinal cultivation legal with the authorization of The Chilean Agriculture Service (SAG) and sale of medication allowed on prescription in pharmacies.
notes_raw: {{main|Cannabis in Chile}} Private personal use<ref>{{cite web|url=http://druglawreform.info/en/country-information/latin-america/chile/item/202-chile|title=Chile – Drug Law Reform in Latin America|author=TNI|access-date=25 February 2016|archive-date=6 October 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181006123221/http://druglawreform.info/en/country-information/latin-america/chile/item/202-chile|url-status=live}}</ref> and recreational cultivation<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.elquintopoder.cl/ciudadania/el-autocultivo-de-cannabis-es-legal-en-chile-tambien-el-colectivo/|title=El cultivo colectivo de Cannabis, legal en Chile|access-date=25 February 2016|date=24 August 2015|archive-date=21 July 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180721073404/https://www.elquintopoder.cl/ciudadania/el-autocultivo-de-cannabis-es-legal-en-chile-tambien-el-colectivo/|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.delaferia.cl/noticia/corte-suprema-autocultivo-de-marihuana-es-legal-en-chile/|title=Autocultivo de marihuana es legal en Chile – Delaferia|work=Delaferia|access-date=25 February 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160225091153/http://www.delaferia.cl/noticia/corte-suprema-autocultivo-de-marihuana-es-legal-en-chile/|archive-date=25 February 2016|url-status=dead|language=es}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Ana María Gazmuri: "En Chile hoy en día el autocultivo es legal"|work=Fundación Daya |url=http://www.fundaciondaya.org/en-chile-hoy-en-dia-el-autocultivo-es-legal/|access-date=11 July 2016|language=es-ES|date=24 August 2015|archive-date=12 October 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181012130524/http://www.fundaciondaya.org/en-chile-hoy-en-dia-el-autocultivo-es-legal/|url-status=live}}</ref> decriminalized. Medicinal cultivation legal with the authorization of The Chilean Agriculture Service (SAG)<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-latin-america-29693386|title=Chile plants cannabis for medicinal use|publisher=[[BBC News]]|access-date=25 February 2016|date=29 October 2014|last=Long|first=Gideon|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170814005239/https://www.bbc.com/news/world-latin-america-29693386|archive-date=14 August 2017|url-status=live}}</ref> and sale of medication allowed on prescription in pharmacies.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.latercera.com/noticia/nacional/2015/10/680-652201-9-en-diciembre-estaria-autorizada-la-venta-de-medicamentos-con-cannabis-en.shtml|title=En diciembre estaría autorizada la venta de medicamentos con cannabis en farmacias|author=Grupo Copesa|date=20 October 2015|access-date=25 February 2016|archive-date=4 March 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304205156/http://www.latercera.com/noticia/nacional/2015/10/680-652201-9-en-diciembre-estaria-autorizada-la-venta-de-medicamentos-con-cannabis-en.shtml|url-status=dead}}</ref>
{{main|Cannabis in Cameroon}}

notes_text: Penalty for possession or consumption: 10–15 days' detention without prosecution and a fine.
notes_raw: {{main|Cannabis in China}} Penalty for possession or consumption: 10–15 days' detention without prosecution and a fine.<ref>{{Cite web|title=Cannabis Use in China – Laws, History, Uses and More Info|url=https://sensiseeds.com/en/blog/countries/cannabis-in-china-laws-use-history/|access-date=23 December 2020|website=Sensi Seeds|date=21 September 2020 |language=en-GB|archive-date=21 December 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201221161749/https://sensiseeds.com/en/blog/countries/cannabis-in-china-laws-use-history/|url-status=live}}</ref>

notes_text: Decriminalized up to for personal consumption. Individuals carrying greater amounts, or cultivating up to 20 plants, cannot be prosecuted if the drug is for personal use.
notes_raw: {{main|Cannabis in Colombia}} Decriminalized up to {{cvt|22|g|frac=4}} for personal consumption. Individuals carrying greater amounts, or cultivating up to 20 plants, cannot be prosecuted if the drug is for personal use.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.semana.com/nacion/articulo/corte-dice-que-dosis-minima-no-es-cuantificable/465394 |title=Drogas: la dosis mínima ya no será tan mínima |publisher=Semana.com |date=14 March 2016 |access-date=23 November 2016 |archive-date=1 August 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180801101750/https://www.semana.com/nacion/articulo/corte-dice-que-dosis-minima-no-es-cuantificable/465394 |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{citation |url = http://www.alcaldiabogota.gov.co/sisjur/normas/Norma1.jsp?i=2774 |title = Ley 30 de 1986 |publisher = alcaldiabogota.gov.co |date = 31 January 1986 |access-date = 5 June 2018 |archive-date = 9 July 2019 |archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20190709104524/https://www.alcaldiabogota.gov.co/sisjur/normas/Norma1.jsp?i=2774 |url-status = live }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/karlazabludovsky/colombia-just-legalized-medical-marijuana |title=Colombia Just Legalized Medical Marijuana |work=[[BuzzFeed News]] |date=22 December 2015 |access-date=22 December 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190611131604/https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/karlazabludovsky/colombia-just-legalized-medical-marijuana |archive-date=11 June 2019 |url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://wp.presidencia.gov.co/sitios/normativa/decretos/2015/Decretos2015/DECRETO%202467%20DEL%2022%20DE%20DICIEMBRE%20DE%202015.pdf |title=Decreto Número 2467 de 2015 |publisher=Ministry of Health and Social Protection (Colombia) |date=22 December 2015 |access-date=22 December 2015 |archive-date=20 December 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171220115842/http://wp.presidencia.gov.co/sitios/normativa/decretos/2015/Decretos2015/DECRETO%202467%20DEL%2022%20DE%20DICIEMBRE%20DE%202015.pdf |url-status=live }}</ref>

notes_text: Decriminalized since police officers do not detain people for personal use, yet no amount has been defined as a minimum for possession. Use of cannabis is widespread throughout the country.

notes_text: On 23 February 2024, the German Bundestag passed the Act on the Controlled Use of Cannabis, legalizing possession of outside the home, at home, and private cultivation of three plants, for adults 18 and over, since 1 April 2024. Collective, noncommercial cultivation is legal in cultivation associations (i.e. cannabis social clubs) since 1 July 2024.
notes_raw: {{main|Cannabis in Germany}} On 23 February 2024, the German Bundestag passed the Act on the Controlled Use of Cannabis, legalizing possession of {{cvt|25|g|frac=8}} outside the home, {{cvt|50|g|frac=8}} at home, and private cultivation of three plants, for adults 18 and over, since 1 April 2024. Collective, noncommercial cultivation is legal in cultivation associations (i.e. [[cannabis social club]]s) since 1 July 2024.<ref>{{cite news |last1=McGuinness|first1=Damien |title=Germany legalises cannabis, but makes it hard to buy|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-68378807 |access-date=23 February 2024 |publisher=[[BBC]] |date=23 February 2024 |archive-date=23 February 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240223120314/https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-68378807|url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last1=Moulson |first1=Geir |title=Germany's parliament votes to legalize limited marijuana possession and allow 'cannabis clubs' |url=https://apnews.com/article/germany-cannabis-parliament-liberalization-possession-sale-e185bbdb2df1dd43e33e829f7a23051a |access-date=23 February 2024 |work=Associated Press |date=23 February 2024}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last1=Schmidt |first1=Nadine |title=Germany legalizes recreational cannabis use |url=https://www.cnn.com/2024/02/23/europe/germany-cannabis-legal-parliament-intl/index.html |access-date=23 February 2024 |work=CNN |date=23 February 2024}}</ref>

notes_text: All actions related to cannabis for own consumption aren't considered criminal offenses, but misdemeanors punishable by a fine. Cannabis trafficking, including sale, import, or cultivation for sale, is punishable by jail time. Legalized in Catalonia in 2017, but that law was challenged by the state and declared unconstitutional. Cultivation in private areas for own consumption is allowed if the plants cannot be seen from the street or other public spaces.
notes_raw: {{main|Cannabis in Spain}} All actions related to cannabis for own consumption aren't considered criminal offenses,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lamarihuana.com/marihuana-y-su-legalidad-en-espana/|title=Marihuana y su legalidad en España|author=Mac|work=La Marihuana|date=23 July 2011|access-date=28 July 2015|archive-date=1 October 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181001184304/https://www.lamarihuana.com/marihuana-y-su-legalidad-en-espana/|url-status=live}}</ref> but misdemeanors punishable by a fine.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.es/2014/08/17/espana-endurece-cannabis_n_5651450.html|title=España endurece las leyes sobre el cannabis en plena corriente mundial por la despenalización|work=El Huffington Post|date=17 August 2014|access-date=28 July 2015|archive-date=12 December 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181212135215/https://www.huffingtonpost.es/2014/08/17/espana-endurece-cannabis_n_5651450.html|url-status=live}}</ref> Cannabis trafficking, including sale, import, or cultivation for sale, is punishable by jail time. Legalized in [[Catalonia]] in 2017,<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/europe/catalonia-marijuana-legalise-cannabis-consumption-distribution-spain-region-petition-a7816981.html|title=Catalonia legalises marijuana consumption, cultivation and distribution|work=[[The Independent]]|access-date=1 July 2017|archive-date=29 June 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180629163654/https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/europe/catalonia-marijuana-legalise-cannabis-consumption-distribution-spain-region-petition-a7816981.html|url-status=live}}</ref> but that law was challenged by the state and declared unconstitutional.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://sensiseeds.com/en/blog/new-decisions-constitutional-court-end-cannabis-tolerance-spain/|title=of the Constitutional Court: The End of Cannabis Tolerance in Spain|date=15 January 2018|access-date=30 August 2018|archive-date=6 April 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180406020517/https://sensiseeds.com/en/blog/new-decisions-constitutional-court-end-cannabis-tolerance-spain/|url-status=live}}</ref> Cultivation in private areas for own consumption is allowed if the plants cannot be seen from the street or other public spaces.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lamarihuana.com/el-auto-cultivo-de-marihuana-se-despenaliza-en-espana/|title=¿El auto cultivo de marihuana se despenaliza en España?|author=Mac|work=La Marihuana|date=8 June 2015|access-date=25 February 2016|archive-date=31 July 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180731123414/https://www.lamarihuana.com/el-auto-cultivo-de-marihuana-se-despenaliza-en-espana/|url-status=live}}</ref>

notes_text: Cannabis is listed in Appendix 1 Narcotics in the DPRK. Narcotics Control Law (2005) states that narcotics may be used when prescribed. However, other reports claim that cannabis is illegal.

notes_text: Possession of was decriminalized in 2009. In 2015 the Supreme Court voted 4–1 that prohibiting people from growing the drug for personal use was unconstitutional. In 2018 the Supreme Court reaffirmed the ruling and requested that the legislature update the country's laws regarding cannabis. After the legislature failed to act, the Supreme Court in 2021 invalidated laws regarding the personal possession and cultivation of cannabis.

notes_text: Illegal since 1965. As of 2022, use and possession of up to are punished with heavy fines and possible loss of driver's license. notes_raw: {{main|Cannabis in Russia}} Possession of up to {{cvt|6|g|frac=5}} of cannabis (or {{cvt|2|g|frac=20|disp=comma}} of hashish) is an administrative offense, punishable by a fine of [[Russian ruble|₽]]5,000 or detention of up to 15 days. notes_text: Use and possession for personal use of any kind of recreational drugs is punishable by imprisonment if caught. Imprisonment for personal use can entail jail time of six months or more. notes_raw: {{main|Cannabis in Saudi Arabia}} Use and possession for personal use of any kind of recreational drugs is punishable by imprisonment if caught. Imprisonment for personal use can entail jail time of six months or more. Dealing and smuggling high amounts of drugs usually result in harsher prison time or even execution, although recently executions have been rare. Foreigners who use drugs might be deported.<ref>{{citation|url=https://travel.state.gov/travel/cis_pa_tw/cis/cis_1012.html |title=International Travel – Saudi Arabia |publisher=[[Bureau of Consular Affairs]] |access-date=17 February 2011 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131211183846/http://travel.state.gov/travel/cis_pa_tw/cis/cis_1012.html |archive-date=11 December 2013 }}</ref>

notes_main_articles.title: Legality of cannabis by U.S. jurisdiction

notes_text: Cannabis remains a Schedule I drug at federal level, prohibiting even its medical use with narrow exceptions. The Rohrabacher–Farr amendment prevents federal enforcement in states that have legalized medical, however. No such protections exist regarding recreational, but the federal government has so far generally not intervened. Recognized Indian reservations are allowed to legalize for either use under a policy announced in 2014. Every U.S. state that has legalized recreational use has set a mandatory legal minimum age of 21 for purchase, possession, and use. In 2024, the Drug Enforcement Administration and the Department of Justice indicated they were planning to reschedule cannabis to Schedule III.
notes_raw: {{Main|Cannabis in the United States|Legality of cannabis by U.S. jurisdiction}} {{See also|Cannabis on American Indian reservations}} Cannabis remains a [[Controlled Substances Act#Schedule I controlled substances|Schedule I drug]] at federal level, prohibiting even its medical use with [[Medical cannabis in the United States#Compassionate IND program|narrow exceptions]]. The [[Rohrabacher–Farr amendment]] prevents federal enforcement in states that have legalized medical, however. No such protections exist regarding recreational, but the federal government has so far generally not intervened. Recognized [[Indian reservation]]s are allowed to legalize for either use under a policy announced in 2014.<ref>{{cite news |url = https://www.nwherald.com/2014/12/12/doj-says-indian-tribes-can-grow-and-sell-marijuana/aee5o5i/ |last1 = Barnard |first1 = Jeff |last2 = Wozniacka |first2 = Gosia |title = the D.O.J. allows indian reservations to grow and sell marijuana |work = [[Northwest Herald]] |agency = [[Associated Press]] |date = 12 December 2014 |access-date = 24 December 2014 |archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20160120131029/https://www.nwherald.com/2014/12/12/doj-says-indian-tribes-can-grow-and-sell-marijuana/aee5o5i/ |archive-date = 20 January 2016 |url-status = live}}</ref> Every U.S. state that has legalized recreational use has set a mandatory legal minimum age of 21 for purchase, possession, and use.<ref>{{cite web |url= https://cannabis.net/blog/news/can-you-buy-weed-if-you-under-21-yearsold-the-statebystate-guide-to-cannabis-age-requirements |title= Can You Buy Weed If You Under 21 Years-Old? – The State-By-State Guide to Cannabis Age Requirements |date= 6 May 2022 |website= Cannabis.net |access-date= 23 June 2023}}</ref> In 2024, the [[Drug Enforcement Administration]] and the [[United States Department of Justice|Department of Justice]] indicated they were planning to [[Removal of cannabis from Schedule I of the Controlled Substances Act|reschedule]] cannabis to [[List of Schedule III controlled substances (U.S.)|Schedule III.]]<ref>{{Cite web |date=2024-04-30 |title=US poised to ease restrictions on marijuana in historic shift, but it'll remain controlled substance |url=https://apnews.com/article/marijuana-biden-dea-criminal-justice-pot-f833a8dae6ceb31a8658a5d65832a3b8 |access-date=2024-05-01 |website=AP News |language=en}}</ref>

notes_text: Possession of up to of marijuana or of genetically modified marijuana for commercial purposes is punishable by 1–2 years in prison at judge's discretion. If deemed to be for personal consumption, the user is subject to security measures involving rehabilitation and detoxification procedures.
notes_raw: {{main|Cannabis in Venezuela}} Possession of up to {{cvt|20|g|frac=4}} of marijuana or {{cvt|5|g|frac=16}} of genetically modified marijuana for commercial purposes is punishable by 1–2 years in prison at judge's discretion. If deemed to be for personal consumption, the user is subject to security measures involving rehabilitation and detoxification procedures.<ref>{{citation |url = http://www.eee.com.ve/upload/LeyOrganicadeDrogas.sept10.pdf |title = Ley Orgánica de Drogas – Sept.10 |access-date = 17 February 2011 |archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20120319163247/http://www.eee.com.ve/upload/LeyOrganicadeDrogas.sept10.pdf |archive-date = 19 March 2012 |url-status = dead}}</ref>

notes_raw: {{main|Cannabis in South Africa}} Private use and cultivation have been legal since September 2018.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://ewn.co.za/2018/09/18/concourt-upholds-ruling-that-private-use-of-dagga-is-legal|title=ConCourt upholds ruling that private use of dagga is legal|first=Mia|last=Lindeque|access-date=18 September 2018|archive-date=30 June 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190630092912/https://ewn.co.za/2018/09/18/concourt-upholds-ruling-that-private-use-of-dagga-is-legal|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.timeslive.co.za/news/south-africa/2018-09-18-ban-on-private-use-of-dagga-at-home-is-ruled-unconstitutional/|title=The highest court has spoken: You are allowed to smoke – and grow – dagga at home|website=TimesLIVE|date=18 September 2018 |access-date=18 September 2018|archive-date=27 November 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181127234223/https://www.timeslive.co.za/news/south-africa/2018-09-18-ban-on-private-use-of-dagga-at-home-is-ruled-unconstitutional/|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |date= 18 September 2018 |title= South Africa's highest court legalises cannabis use |url= https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-africa-45559954 |publisher= BBC News |access-date= 4 November 2021 |archive-date= 4 November 2021 |archive-url= https://web.archive.org/web/20211104002656/https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-africa-45559954 |url-status= live }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last= Gwegwe |first= Siseko |date= 12 October 2021 |title= Cannabis weed in South Africa – What's legal and what's not? |url= https://www.thesouthafrican.com/news/cannabis-marijuana-weed-legal-status-in-south-africa-law-government/ |work= TheSouthAfrican.com |access-date= 4 November 2021 |archive-date= 4 November 2021 |archive-url= https://web.archive.org/web/20211104004200/https://www.thesouthafrican.com/news/cannabis-marijuana-weed-legal-status-in-south-africa-law-government/ |url-status= live }}</ref>
